Chip Component Showcase

The Chip component is a versatile element for displaying compact information, representing input entities, filtering content, or triggering actions. Chips are small, interactive elements that typically represent a discrete piece of information, entity, or action.

Basic Chips

Simple chips with different variants and colors.

Chip Types

Different types of chips for various use cases.

Chip Sizes

Chips in different sizes.

Color Variants

Filled chips in different colors.

Outlined chips in different colors.

With Icons

Chips with leading and trailing icons.

With Avatar

Chips with avatar images.

Removable Chips

Chips with remove buttons.

States

Chips in different states.

Truncated Text

Chips with truncated text and tooltips.

Chip Collections

Groups of related chips.

Usage Example

Example of how to use the Chip component in HTML:

<!-- Basic chip -->
<gds-chip label="Basic Chip"></gds-chip>

<!-- Outlined primary chip with icon -->
<gds-chip
  label="Primary Chip"
  variant="outlined"
  color="primary"
  leadingIcon="star"
></gds-chip>

<!-- Removable input chip -->
<gds-chip
  label="john.doe@example.com"
  type="input"
  removable
></gds-chip>

<!-- Filter chip with selection -->
<gds-chip
  label="Category: Electronics"
  type="filter"
  selected
  clickable
></gds-chip>

<!-- Disabled chip -->
<gds-chip
  label="Unavailable"
  disabled
></gds-chip>

<!-- Choice chip with icon -->
<gds-chip
  label="Small"
  type="choice"
  clickable
  trailingIcon="expand_more"
></gds-chip>

<!-- Action chip -->
<gds-chip
  label="Add to cart"
  type="action"
  clickable
  leadingIcon="shopping_cart"
  color="success"
></gds-chip>

Keyboard Navigation

The Chip component supports keyboard navigation:

  • Tab: Move focus to the next focusable element
  • Shift + Tab: Move focus to the previous focusable element
  • Enter or Space: Activate the chip (if clickable)
  • Delete or Backspace: Remove the chip (if removable)
  • Escape: Blur/deselect the chip

Try using keyboard navigation with the chips below:
